DataElement.preferredName: Adverse Event Pulmonary Embolism Present First Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the date of the first occurrence of a pulmonary embolism, a closure of the pulmonary artery or one of its branches by an embolus, sometimes associated with infarction of the lung as an unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure being present.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a closure of the pulmonary artery or one of its branches by an embolus, sometimes associated with infarction of the lung as an unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure being present.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

Property.preferredDefinition: The closure of the pulmonary artery or one of its branches by an embolus, sometimes associated with infarction of the lung.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: The obstruction of the pulmonary artery or one of its branches by an embolus, sometimes associated with infarction of the lung.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the first date of an assessment, test, or treatment.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

DataElement.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form
